# React Native Doctor

Diagnose React Native & Expo codebase health. Scans for security, performance, correctness, accessibility, and architecture issues, then outputs a 0â€“100 score with actionable diagnostics.

## Usage

Run this at your project root:

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest .
```

Use `--verbose` to see affected files and line numbers:

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . --verbose
```

Use `--score` to output only the numeric score:

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . --score
```

Use `-y` to skip prompts (required for non-interactive environments like CI or coding agents):

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . -y
```

## Options

```
Usage: react-native-doc [options] [command] [directory]

Arguments:
  directory              project directory to scan (default: ".")

Options:
  -v, --version          display the version number
  --no-lint              skip linting
  --no-dead-code         skip dead code detection
  --verbose              show file details per rule
  --score                output only the score
  -y, --yes              skip prompts, scan all workspace projects
  --project <name>       select workspace project (comma-separated for multiple)
  --diff [base]          scan only files changed vs base branch
  --fix                  open Ami to auto-fix all issues
  --cline                run Cline CLI (or copy prompt to clipboard for VS Code/Cline extension)
  --prompt               copy latest scan output to clipboard
  --expo-only            force-enable Expo rules even if expo is not detected
  --rn-only              force-enable React Native rules even if react-native is not detected
  -h, --help             display help for command

Commands:
  fix [directory]        Open Ami to auto-fix react-native-doc issues
  install-ami            Install Ami and open it to auto-fix issues
  fix-cline [directory]  Run Cline CLI to fix issues (or copy prompt for VS Code/Cline extension)
```

## Fixing issues with AI agents

After a scan, react-native-doc can hand off to an AI coding agent to fix all reported issues automatically.

### Ami

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . --fix
# or
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . fix
```

Opens [Ami](https://ami.dev) with a pre-filled fix prompt and auto-submit enabled.

### Cline

```bash
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . --cline
# or
npx -y react-native-doc@latest . fix-cline
```

If the `cline` CLI is installed (`npm install -g cline`), runs `cline task -y` directly in the terminal with the fix prompt and working directory set. Otherwise falls back to copying the fix prompt to clipboard and opening VS Code so it can be pasted into the Cline extension.
